testcase.brief: A minimium configuration for layer 3 vpn
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
Test Procedure:
-CVG side: -configure a xauth-client-list -enable server-ipsec-tunnel layer-3 mode -bind the client-list to ipsec-tunnel -bind the ipsec-tunnel to tunnel-policy -BR side: -configure client-ipsec-tunnel layer-3 mode enable -configure ipsec-tunnel gateway -bind the ipsec-tunnel to tunnel-policy -leave all other parameters default -check ike sa/sp, ipsec sa BR/CVG -check layer-3-tunnel on BR/CVG -check ipsec-tunnel

step.desc: config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config mgt0.2 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface vlan${br1.vpc2.vlan} dhcp-server enable"

step.multi-setvar: echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.2.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns2.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification

step.telnet: -v "show log buf" -v "" -v "" -v "clear log buf" -v "" -v "no _debug vpn info" -v ""

step.desc: setup all eth1 interface as access mode

step.telnet: -v "user-profile sta qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport mode access" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} switchport access vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}"

step.desc: Laptop1 connect to lan port eth2
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
enable debug on BR _ff id 1 protocol 47, _ff id 2 protocol 47, _ff id 1 protocol 1
step.telnet: -v "clear log buffered" -v "_ff id 1 protocol 1" -v "_ff id 2 protocol 47 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 3 protocol 50 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"

step.desc: -ping from vpc1 to a dst behind CVG

step.log-match: -b "\(i\) tunnel0 ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}->${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}.*icmp-echo-reply" -ps p "GRE-decap packet done => ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}->${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}" p "GRE-encap packet: ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}->${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}" p "iptables FORWARD pkt ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}\(vlan${br1.vpc1.vlan}\)\-\>${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}\(tunnel0\)" -e "\(i\) ${br1.br.lan.kport1} ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip}->${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip}.*icmp-echo-req" -f ${log.dir}/${log.file}
